title: Complex Air Defense: Countering the Hypersonic Missile Threat
description: Hypersonic missiles are not unstoppable. Numerous efforts tailored to exploit key vulnerabilities of the hypersonic flight regime can make hypersonic defense a tractable problem.

title: Covid-19 Vaccine Confidence at One Year
description: Please join the CSIS-LSHTM High-Level Panel on Vaccine Confidence and Misinformation to reflect on what has been learned over the first year of the Covid-19 vaccine rollout, and what more can be done to strengthen vaccine confidence in the United States and globally.

title: Russia and the Threat of Massive Cyberattack
description: This commentary by Jim Lewis discusses cyber in the context of Russia's grand strategy and the possibility of a cyberattack on U.S. critical infrastructure.

title: Indonesia’s Battery Industrial Strategy
description: Indonesia wants to become an EV battery producer and exporter, aiming at 140 GWh in 2030—from zero production capacity today.

title: Getting (Dis)closure: U.S. Regulatory Changes Leading to Climate-Related Financial Disclosures
description: Americans want climate-related financial disclosures for business and financial institutions to help speed up the green transition; President Biden is waiting on the SEC to put forth regulation.

title: The Evening: ISIS Leader Killed, Russia Plot Exposed, Let it Bleed, and More
description: This edition of CSIS's nightly newsletter covers ISIS Leader Killed, Russia Plot Exposed, Let it Bleed, and More.

title: Spotlight - Malaysia: February 3, 2022
description: Last month, the sultan of Johor dissolved the State Assembly, and the Election Commission will set a polling day before March 23.

title: The Latest on Southeast Asia: February 3, 2022
description: The Omicron variant has begun to spread in Southeast Asia’s largest countries, just as many governments were preparing to consider the virus “endemic” and adjust policy responses accordingly.

title: Hunger on the Heels of a Possible Ukraine Invasion
description: Hunger is on the heels of a possible Ukraine invasion. If diplomacy fails, what would the fallout mean for global food security?

title: Avoiding the Red Card: The Challenge of Separating Sports and Politics in China
description: In recent years, it has seemed like Groundhog Day for sports in China – time and time again, international sports leagues expand into China only to become entangled in China’s political affairs and face consequences.

title: Divestment Doesn’t Mean Degrowth
description: Associate Fellow Emily Benson explores how countries on the African continent could meet their energy needs by investing in renewable energy rather than fossil fuels.

title: The Costs of Hun Sen’s Doomed Myanmar Policy
description: Hun Sen’s approach to Myanmar will not bring peace; instead, it will worsen the situation within Myanmar, augment intra-ASEAN tensions, and undermine the grouping’s relationship with the United States, ultimately weakening ASEAN’s claims to regional centrality.
